decks.notes: The deck focuses on quickly filling the graveyard with "Oops, All Spells!" combo pieces using fast mana and discard spells, eventually casting Balustrade Spy to mill the entire deck. Thassa's Oracle or Dread Return with another creature are used to win the game by either decking the opponent or creating a lethal board presence. The deck also includes protection in the form of Pact of Negation and disruptive elements like Cabal Therapy. The key strategy is to combo off as quickly as possible while handling disruption from the opponent.

This deck focuses on utilizing aggressive tactics and disruption spells to control the pace of the game and quickly overwhelm the opponent. By efficiently using cards like Daze, Force of Will, Fatal Push, and Thoughtseize to disrupt the opponent's strategy while deploying threats like Murktide Regent and Brazen Borrower to apply pressure, the deck aims to maintain tempo and secure victory. The inclusion of efficient card draw and selection spells like Brainstorm and Ponder help ensure consistency in drawing the necessary cards for both disruption and aggression.

This deck focuses on disrupting the opponent's game plan while quickly putting pressure on the board. With a mix of powerful disruption spells like Force of Will, Daze, and Thoughtseize, along with efficient threats like Murktide Regent and Brazen Borrower, this deck aims to control the game tempo and dictate the pace of the match. Utilizing a combination of counter magic and creature removal, the deck looks to keep the opponent on the back foot while deploying threats to close out the game quickly.

The deck is focused on casting multiple spells in a single turn to build up storm count and finish the game with a massive Tendrils of Agony. The main goal is to use fast mana sources like Lotus Petal, Dark Ritual, and Lion's Eye Diamond to generate a large amount of mana quickly, while filtering through the deck with cantrips like Brainstorm and Ponder. Key cards like Infernal Tutor and Burning Wish provide additional consistency and flexibility, allowing the player to find the necessary combo pieces to win the game efficiently.

This deck focuses on using artifacts as a quick way to generate mana and control the board while applying pressure on the opponent. The key strategy is to use cards like Emry, Lurker of the Loch and Mox Opal to quickly bring out powerful artifacts like Mishra's Bauble and Patchwork Automaton. Force of Will provides protection while cards like Pinnacle Emissary and Kappa Cannoneer deal damage to the opponent. Urza's Saga and Memory Guardian provide additional value and synergy within the deck.

The main concept of this Eldrazi Aggro deck is to put pressure on the opponent quickly and efficiently by playing powerful Eldrazi creatures like Eldrazi Linebreaker and Reality Smasher. The deck also aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan by using cards like Wasteland and Chalice of the Void. By utilizing mana acceleration cards like Lotus Petal and Simian Spirit Guide, the deck can quickly cast its threats and overwhelm the opponent. The deck's mana base, with cards like Eye of Ugin and Cavern of Souls, supports the Eldrazi theme and ensures smooth gameplay.

The deck focuses on quickly deploying threats like Dragon's Rage Channeler and Murktide Regent in order to apply pressure on the opponent. It also includes disruptive elements like Daze, Force of Will, and Thoughtseize to protect its own threats and interact with the opponent's game plan. The deck's mana base is carefully crafted to support its spells and maximize its efficiency. The inclusion of cards like Brazen Borrower and Kaito, Bane of Nightmares provide additional versatility and versatility in dealing with a wide range of threats.

The primary focus of this deck is to utilize the Mystic Forge combo alongside various artifact cards to generate infinite mana and deck manipulation. By utilizing cards like Urza's Workshop, Lotus Petal, and Manifold Key, the deck aims to quickly assemble the necessary pieces to combo off and win the game. Additionally, cards like Tezzeret, Cruel Captain and Karn, the Great Creator provide additional synergy and support to the combo strategy. Overall, the key theme of this deck is to assemble the Mystic Forge combo and generate powerful synergies through artifact manipulation.

The key concept of this deck is to control the game by using powerful control spells like Force of Will, Swords to Plowshares, and Stifle, while also utilizing powerful creatures like Stoneforge Mystic, Murktide Regent, and Phelia, Exuberant Shepherd. The deck also aims to generate card advantage and disruption with cards like Tamiyo, Inquisitive Student and Teferi, Time Raveler. Finally, the deck uses mana denial strategies with Wasteland and disruption with counterspells like Daze to maintain control of the game until it can close out with its powerful threats.

The main focus of this deck is to quickly assemble the necessary cards and resources to cast Doomsday, allowing the player to stack their library in a specific order to guarantee a win condition with Thassa's Oracle. The deck utilizes cards like Brainstorm, Ponder, and Personal Tutor to search for key pieces, while also incorporating disruption and protection spells like Force of Will and Daze to ensure the combo goes off without a hitch. The inclusion of cards like Lion's Eye Diamond and Lotus Petal provide additional mana acceleration to help execute the combo efficiently.

This deck revolves around the powerful Eldrazi creatures that can quickly overwhelm the opponent with their size and abilities. By utilizing cards like Cavern of Souls and Chalice of the Void to ensure your Eldrazi spells can't be countered, as well as Eldrazi Temple and Eye of Ugin to ramp up to play them quickly, this deck aims to put pressure on the opponent early and maintain it throughout the game. With a mix of aggressive creatures and disruptive spells, this deck is designed to be relentless in its attacks and difficult for the opponent to handle.

This deck focuses on generating multiple mana sources quickly with artifacts like Mox Opal and Lotus Petal, while using cards like Emry, Lurker of the Loch to recur artifacts from the graveyard. It also utilizes Chalice of the Void to disrupt opponent's plays and relies on powerful artifact creatures like Patchwork Automaton and Pinnacle Emissary to quickly close out the game. The inclusion of Urza's Saga helps to further ramp up artifact production and supports the deck's aggressive playstyle. Additionally, it utilizes control elements like Force of Will to protect its key pieces.

This Bant Control deck focuses on manipulating the game through card draw, counterspells, and removal spells to maintain board control. By utilizing cards like Brainstorm, Force of Will, Swords to Plowshares, and Tamiyo, Inquisitive Student, the deck aims to control the pace of the game and outvalue the opponent. With a mix of efficient answers and card advantage engines, the deck aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan while building towards a win condition with cards like Murktide Regent and Phelia, Exuberant Shepherd.

This deck focuses on utilizing lands as a resource to control the game. By constantly recurring lands with Life from the Loam and using cards like Exploration and Mox Diamond to ramp up mana, the deck aims to disrupt the opponent's strategy with Wasteland, Ghost Quarter, and Rishadan Port. It also has the potential to create a powerful 20/20 Marit Lage token with Dark Depths and Thespian's Stage. The inclusion of Sphere of Resistance and The Tabernacle at Pendrell Vale further adds to the control aspect of the deck, making it difficult for the opponent to execute their game plan.

The main concept of this Legacy deck is to disrupt the opponent's strategy while maintaining tempo and pressure through the use of efficient creatures and disruptive spells. With cards like Thoughtseize, Force of Will, and Daze, the deck aims to control the opponent's hand and board state while quickly deploying threats like Brazen Borrower, Kaito, Bane of Nightmares, and Murktide Regent. The deck also includes cards like Fatal Push and Orcish Bowmasters to deal with opposing creatures, making it a versatile and aggressive tempo deck in the Legacy format.

This Boros Aggro deck focuses on quick and aggressive creature plays, backed up by powerful removal spells like Swords to Plowshares. The inclusion of Jegantha, the Wellspring as a companion ensures consistent mana acceleration for explosive turns. Efficient creatures like Amped Raptor and Sand Scout are complemented by cards like Goblin Bombardment and Static Prison to control the board and maintain pressure on the opponent. With a mix of powerful creatures and disruptive spells, this deck aims to overwhelm the opponent quickly and assert dominance in the early game.
